poem:
**The Birmingham Bull**  

From bronze to breath, an urban ghost,  
cloven-hoofed on concrete, midday toast.  
The city stops, street laughter stalls  
as wheels give way to pounding walls.  
Spirits stir at the sight, alive once more,  
a bull in Birmingham, myth out the door.  
On asphalt plains its heartbeats drum,  
the shopfront saga yet to come.

The bull could be seen galloping past cars on a road near a roundabout and running along". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long.
